metadata.Description: A theory of change is a comprehensive and systematic explanation of how and why a desired change is expected to happen. It outlines the causal pathways and assumptions underlying a project or intervention.

entities.Description: Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Cooperatives that enable individuals or communities to collectively own and manage energy resources.

relations.Description: The theory of change addresses the barriers to renewable energy adoption by identifying and implementing strategies to overcome challenges related to policy, finance, and technology.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change employs impact evaluation methods to assess the effectiveness and outcomes of sustainable energy interventions and initiatives.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change collaborates with academic institutions to leverage research and expertise in developing evidence-based strategies for sustainable energy transition.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change supports innovation in clean technologies by providing funding and resources for research and development of sustainable energy solutions.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change administers energy efficiency programs to promote energy conservation and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change measures the social impact of sustainable energy initiatives by assessing changes in quality of life, access to energy, and environmental outcomes.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change aligns with climate action plans to ensure the integration of sustainable energy goals and targets in broader climate mitigation and adaptation strategies.
relations.Subject: theory of change

relations.Description: The theory of change is an instance of strategic planning that guides the development and implementation of sustainable energy initiatives and interventions.
relations.Subject: theory of change
energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency collaborates with industries to develop and implement energy-saving measures and technologies.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency supports the integration of renewable energy sources into the energy system to improve overall energy efficiency.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals by contributing to the goal of affordable and clean energy for all.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency is an instance of energy conservation, which aims to reduce energy consumption and waste.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy cooperatives
relations.Description: Energy cooperatives address energy poverty by providing affordable and sustainable energy solutions to underserved communities.
